data.scheme_name: New Industrial Policy 2020-25-Technology Adoption & Innovation for MSMEs-Interest Subsidy on Technology Up-gradation Loan For General Category (Male Entrepreneurs)
data.benefits: Scheme provides various incentives such as interest subsidy, Technology Adoption, Quality Certification, etc.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC).  Eligible Enterprise shall submit application for sanction of Investment Promotion subsidy within one year from the date of commencement of commercial production.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
• Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC). Note- If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval.
  • The eligible enterprise shall not carry out any trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products from its place of business. The eligible unit shall have to obtain a separate registration, if the unit carries out trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products. If carried out, this turnover will not be eligible for availing Investment promotion subsidy. Resale of products / goods by the eligible unit will not be considered for turnover incentives.
  • Eligible Enterprise shall submit application for sanction of Investment Promotion subsidy within one year from the date of commencement of commercial production.
data.nodal_agency: State Level Co-ordination Committee (SLCC), Government of Karnataka
data.context: Government is pleased to announce the New Industrial Policy 2020-25, to build on the strengths of Karnataka industry and to enable it to fulfill its role as the engine of growth and to shoulder responsibility of adding more hi-tech value and employment. The new industrial revolution presents new opportunities for industry, particularly manufacturing and manufacturing-related service industries. These developments are enabling smart manufacturing, customization, collaborative production and other new production modes and business models.
data.objective: The aim is to attract INR 5 Lakh crore in investments, create 20 lakh jobs, achieve 3rd position in merchandise exports, maintain a 10% industrial growth rate, and foster an ecosystem for technology adoption and innovation.
data.description:
A. Interest Subsidy on Technology Up-gradation Loan- 

Zone 1 : 5% for 6 years Zone 2 : 5% for 5 years Zone 3 : 5% for 5 years on loans availed from Karnataka State Financial Corporation & Scheduled Commercial Banks which are not covered under CLCSS of Government of India 

B. Technology Adoption- 

For All Zones- Capital Subsidy of 25% of cost (max. Rs 50,000) for adopting technology from recognized national laboratories. 

C. Technology Business Incubation Centre (TBIC)- 

For All Zones- Capital Subsidy of 25% of the cost of incubation centre (max. Rs 50 lakh) Note- Minimum 1 Technology Business Incubation Centre (TBIC) should be in Zone 1 

D. Incentives for Quality Certification- 

For All Zones- Reimbursements of- 1. ISO Series Certification: 75% of cost (max. Rs 75,000) 2. BIS Certification: 50% of fees payable to BIS for certification (max. INR 20,000/-) & 25% of cost (max. Rs 50,000) for purchase of testing equipment as approved by Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS).
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can register themselves on EBIZ- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/InvestorRegistrationForm.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.funding_mechanism: Amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary after approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
Zonal Classification- Zone 1: Holalkere, Channagiri, Jagalur, Honnali, Gudibande, Bagepalli, Chickaballapura, Srinivasapura, Soraba, Hosanagara, Shikaripura, Madhugiri, Koratagere, Gubbi, Pavagada, Chikkanayakanahalli, Yelandur, Gundlupet, Hanur, Chamarajanagar, Kollegal, Arakalgud, Belur, Arasikere, Madikeri, Somwarpet, Virajpet, Ponnampete, Kushalnagar, Bilagi, Badami, Mudhol, Jamkhandi, Hunagund, Guledgudda, Rabakavi-Banahatti, Terdal, Ilkal, Bagalkote, Bailhongal, Soundathi, Chikkodi, Raibag, Khanapur, Ramdurg, Hukkeri, Athani, Gokak, Nippani, Kagavadi, Mudalgi, Yaragatti, Kittur, Belagavi, Sindgi, Indi, Muddebihal, B Bagewadi, Alamela, Babaleshwar, Nidagundi, Tikota, Chedachana, Kolhar, Devarahipparagi, Talikote. Vijayapura, Navalgund, Kalghatagi, Kundaghol, Annigeri, Alnavar, Hubballi (R), Dharwada, Hubballi(U), Mundargi, Nargund, Ron, Shirahatti, Gajendragad, Lakshmeshwar, Gadag, Savanur, Shiggaon, Hirekerur, Hanagal, Ranebennur, Byadagi, Rattihalli, Haveri, Honnavar, Sirsi, Mundagod, Yellapura, Siddapura, Haliyal, Joida, Bhatkal, Ankola, Kumta, Dandeli, Karwar, H B Halli, Hadagalli, Kudligi, Hospet, Sandur, Siraguppa, Harappana Halli, Kurogod, Kottur, Kampli, Ballari, Bhalki, Humnabad,, BasavaKalyana, Aurad, Chitaguppa, Hulusur, Kamala Nagar, Bidar, Afzalpur, Aland, Jewargi, Sedam, Chittapur, Chincholi, Kalagi, Kamalapur, Yedrami, Shahabad, Kalaburagi, Yadgiri, Shahapur, Shorapur, Hunasagi, Vadagera, Gurumitkal, Kushtagi, Yelburga, Gangavathi, Kukkunur, Karatagi, Kanakagiri, Koppal, Sindhanur, Manvi, Lingasugur, Devadurga, Maski, Siravara, Raichur.
  • Zone 2: Magadi, Ramanagara, Channapatna, Kanakapura, Harohalli, Hiriyur, Chitradurga, Challakere, Hosadurga, Molkalmuru, Davanagere, Harihar, Nyamati, Chintamani, Gowribidanur, Siddlaghatta, Cheluru, Bangarpet, KGF, Kolar, Malur, Mulbagal, Sagar, ThirthahaIli, Shivamogga, Bhadravathi, Turuvekere, Sira, Tiptur, Kunigal, Tumakur, Kadur, Mudigere, Tarikere, Chikkamagaluru, Ajjampur, Shringeri, Koppa, N R Pura, Kalasa, Bantwal, Sulya, Belthangadi, Puttur, Mulki, Ullal, Moodbidri, Kadaba, Mangalore, Alur, C R Patna, Shantigrama, Hassan, H N Pura, Sakleshpura, Srirangapatna, Pandavapura, Mandya, Maddur, Nagamangala, Malavalli, K R Pet, Hunsur, K R Nagara, Mysuru, Nanjangud, T N Pura, Periyapatna, H D Kote, Saraguru, Saligrama, Karkala, Bhramhavara, Udupi, Kundapura, Kapu, Hebri, Baindur.
  • Zone 3: Anekal, Bengaluru (N), Bengaluru (S), Yelahanka, Bengaluru (E), Devanahalli, Doddaballapura, Hoskote, Nelamangala
    • The Investment Promotion Subsidy is based on a percentage of turnover, depending on location and investments, for a specified period or fixed asset value. Eligible enterprises must register separately under GST for manufacturing eligible products, and only this turnover will be considered for the subsidy. Trading or non-eligible services at the same business location will disqualify the enterprise from the subsidy. The resale of products is not eligible for turnover incentives. If the enterprise is already manufacturing the same product in existing units, the turnover for five consecutive years must not be lower than the average of the previous three years. Only new investments qualify for the incentive.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Common Application Form* 
2. Partnership deed / Articles of Association/byelaws 
3. Self-attested Project Report 
4. Udyam Registration Certificate /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL)  
5. Udyam Registration Certificate 
6. First Sale Invoice 
7. Lease deed of land (KIADB/KSSIDC/SEZ/FOOD PARK/KEONICS/CO-OP IND AREA/PVT. IND AREA) (if applicable) 
8. Loan release order 
9. Power sanction letter 
10. Power service letter 
11. Land conversion order issued by Revenue Department if applicable 
12. Layout map (Showing the land utilization in respect of individual enterprises) 
13. GST Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
14. ESI Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
15. EPF Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
16. Approved building plan or license obtained from competent authority 
17. Certificate from the Textile Department (for not availing any subsidy in respect of Textile based industries including Readymade Garment) 
18. Certified from Department of Agriculture/Horticulture for not availed subsidy in respect of Agro Food Processing Industry in any of the Government of Karnataka/India Schemes 
19. Statement of Fixed Assets in prescribed format in Annexure–5* 
20. Original Investment certificate format as in Annexure–6* 
21. Original Certificate from Civil Engineer/Architect in prescribed format in respect of investment made in building as in Annexure–7* 
22. Form of declaration regarding employment of local persons in the prescribed format as in Annexure–8* 
23. Original investment certificate from Chartered Accountant in prescribed format as in Annexure–9* in respect of small and medium enterprises 
24. Caste certificate 
25. Ex-service men certificate, if applicable
